chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant David L. Cantrell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTE/schooling and when not fully engaged, must complete 5 hours community service.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.  
No contact with persons under the age of 18 who are not his direct relatives.  
AMENDED
Internet access is permitted subject to agent's discretion for the purposes of job searchs. 
No viewing or possession of any pornography.

Random UA's.  
Sex offender registry for 15 years. 
DNA sample. 

TREATMENT:  Complete Cognitive Behavioral Intervention Program, Sex Offender Treatment, AODA and follow up.  Enroll and complete the SAFE program.  Any assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended by agent.  

Mental Health Program put in place by a doctor which may include appropriate medication and defendant to comply with medications and only within the prescribed amounts. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: SERVE 6 months jail with huber privileges for work, school, treatment.  STAY 6 months jail.  NO EMP.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David L. Cantrell

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 3:21 pm
Includes 14CF894 and 15CF48.
Clerk: Kassidi
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Peter Prusinski.
VRCW.
Atty Gramer makes statement. Atty Prusinski states correction to PSI on the record. 
State makes argument. Defense makes argument. Defendant makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS:
14CF894:
Ct. 1 (Child Enticement-Sexual Contact)>> Sentence W/H- 10 years probation, concurrent to Ct 2. CONDITIONS: 1 Year MCJ, Serve 6 months w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment and I/S 6 months MCJ. 
NO EMP. Absolute sobriety from Drugs and Alcohol. Participate in Random UA's. No contact with persons under the age of 18 who are not his direct relatives, No access to the Internet, No viewing or possession of any pornography, Sex Offender Registry for 15 years, Good faith effort to maintain Full time work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 5 hours Community Serivce, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Treatment: Complete Cognitive Behavoriral Intervention Program, Sex Offender Treatment, AODA and follow up, Enroll and Complete the SAFE Program, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended by agent, Mental Health Program put in place by a doctor which may include appropriate medication and Defendant to comply with medications and only within the prescribed amount. COURT finds 3 days credit on Ct. 1.

15CF48:
Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>> I/S 4 years WSPS. 2 years IC and 2 years ES, concurrent to probation in Ct 1. CONDITIONS: 1 Year MCJ, Serve 6 months w/Huber privileges for work/school/treatment and I/S 6 months MCJ. 
NO EMP. Absolute sobriety from Drugs and Alcohol. Participate in Random UA's. No contact with persons under the age of 18 who are not his direct relatives, No access to the Internet, No viewing or possession of any pornography, Sex Offender Registry for 15 years, Good faith effort to maintain Full time work/Full time school and when not fully engaged must complete 5 hours Community Serivce, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Treatment: Complete Cognitive Behavoriral Intervention Program, Sex Offender Treatment, AODA and follow up, Enroll and Complete the SAFE Program, Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended by agent, Mental Health Program put in place by a doctor which may include appropriate medication and Defendant to comply with medications and only within the prescribed amount. COURT finds 3 days credit on Ct. 2.


REMANDED TO MARATHON CO. SHERIFFS DEPARTMENT.
PSI TO BE SEALED.

Adj: 4:09 pm
Copy of PSI to ADA Lisa Gramer & Atty Peter Prusinski
Sentencing hearing on August 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
AMENDED
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 9:07 a.m.
**Includes 14CF894 & 15CF48**
State appears by ADA Elisabeth Gramer. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Peter Prusinski. Date & time set for Preliminary Hearing in 15CF48. Waiver of Preliminary Examination filed. Court questions defendant regarding waiver. Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. COURT finds PC- Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. Information filed. Reading Waived. 
State files amended Information in 14CF894. COURT accepts amended Information. 
State notes parties have reached an agreement and proceed with Plea Hearing in both files. State notes case involving Everest Metro PD will not be charged and recites police report number. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW. 
State moves to: 14CF894- Amend Ct.1- Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime to Attempted Child Enticement.
                            15CF48- DRI Ct.1- Child Abuse- Intentionally Cause Harm & DRI Ct. 3- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 14CF894- Ct.1- Child Enticement>>GUILTY
            15CF48-  Ct.2- Bail Jumping (Felony)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: PSI to be completed. Sentencing Hearing to be set within 60 days. Parties to set Sentencing Hearing with JA following court. 
Bond is continued. 
Adj: 9:26 a.m.
Plea hearing on June 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on May 22, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on March 18, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on February 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

$5,000.00 WITH FIRST $2,000.00 CASH The defendant's wife Mae Cantrell is required to co-sign the bond.   No contact with children under 18 years of age except for his own children. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No use of computers except for use of public compluters at the University of Wisconsin-Stevens Point James H. Albertson Center for Learning Resources University library only for the limited purposes of completing university assignments and school related work. Cannot volunteer for Boy Scouts while case is pending.
